newsitem.title: INDIA: At least five Kashmiri militants killed in clash.
newsitem.headline: At least five Kashmiri militants killed in clash.

text.p: At least five separatist guerrillas were killed on Saturday in a gunbattle with Indian security forces near the Pakistani border in India's troubled state of Jammu and Kashmir, a defence spokesman said.

"Army soldiers laid ambush to a group of militants who inflitrated from Pakistan. In the encounter, which lasted for several hours near Rangwar Gali of Kupwara district, at least five militants were killed," the Indian spokesman said.
Rangwar Gali lies in the forests of Kupwara district, 85 kms (55 miles), north of state's summer capital Srinagar.
A large quantity of arms and ammunition was recovered, he added.
It was the fourth major clash in the dense forests of Kupwara near the border this month.
Over a dozen militant groups are fighting New Delhi's rule in Jammu and Kashmir, India's only Moslem majority state.
India accuses Pakistan of arming Kashmiri militants, but Islamabad says it only provides political and diplomatic support to separatists.
Police and hospitals say more than 20,000 people have been killed in seven-year-old rebllion. Abdullah says the toll is nearer to 50,000.
